bug.author: rgiduthuri
bug.summary: Caffe to NNEF converter is producing incorrect NNEF structure file
bug.description:
Below is the example that I used for this test: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/BVLC/caffe/blob/master/examples/cifar10/cifar10_quick.prototxt>https://github.com/BVLC/caffe/blob/master/examples/cifar10/cifar10_quick.prototxt</denchmark-link>
The caffe export script is using 'deploy.desc' filename instead of 'graph.nnef' filename specified in Section 5.1 of the spec. Generated text is not valid per the nnef-validator.

comments.comment: You are right that the file name is incorrect, that's an easy fix. However, I cannot see the problem with the generated text. Can you post the error message? On my side the validator accepts it. What are the command-line arguments for the validator execution? Doesn't it fail upon checking the data files and it may be related to the other issue?

With the most recent commit, I see that it is creating 'graph.nnef' file instead of 'deploy.desc'. One issue is still left. The converter is generating 5L which is not legal syntax. <denchmark-code>conv1_filter = variable(label = 'conv1/filter', shape = [32, 3, 5L, 5L]) </denchmark-code>
Added a branch fix_int_literal to treat this issue, can you test it on your side?
This seems to fix the reported issue. Thanks.
